page.title: 06River walk. Bradford to Hele
page.content: Our walk started from Bradford-on-Tone bridge, probably a 15th century structure as the 1698 carved on the parapets undoubtedly refers to the date of repairs. We followed the North side of the river past the scene of a murder of a milkman in the early 1980's who tried to intervene in a domestic crisis. Hele Manor and a riding school with its jumping course were passed on the other side and we enjoyed the wealth of blackberries and opportunities to 'skim' stones in the weir pools. A sewage farm and the remains of the Grand Western Canal were seen and our attention was temporarily distracted by the buzzing of the overhead cables leading to the CEGB transmission station.
